definition: a small appetizer/a piece of cake; very easy (idiom)
small/tiny/few/young
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
dish/plate

sentences.english: This consists of a Cable and Apricorn cloning software.
sentences.chinese: 這包括一個小菜一碟電纜和克隆軟件。

sentences.english: Speaking good English is a pice of cake.
sentences.chinese: 說一口流利的英語是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: It was very easy for him to pour the whole bottle of wine into his throat.
sentences.chinese: 將整瓶酒到進喉嚨對他來說是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: W2: No, I think learning a foreign language is a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 不難，我覺得學一門外語是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: It's really short, less than half a minute; just a piece of cake for you.
sentences.chinese: 視頻很短纔不到半分鐘，對你而言就是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: It is a piece of cake for me.
So, if you've worked the homework problems, you will do the homework quiz handily.
sentences.chinese: 如果你已經做了作業上的問題，那個測試就小菜一碟。

sentences.english: But compared to debating the legalisation of drugs, that was a doddle.
sentences.chinese: 但是與毒品合法化辯論相比，那只是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: Once I’ve done that, it’s a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你做到了這一點，接下來的事情就是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: Back door has a five-pin tumbler system, single-circuit alarm. Child's play.
sentences.chinese: 後門是五鎖連環栓，單迴路報警系統，小菜一碟。

sentences.english: It would be so little to You, God, such a little, little thing.
sentences.chinese: 上帝，對你來說這簡直就是小菜一碟，舉手之勞。

sentences.english: English is a piece of cake. But life is a dard cake.
sentences.chinese: 英語是小菜一碟，但是生活是一塊艱難的旅程。

sentences.english: You may be admitted to a well-known college and win scholarships, not to mention gaining the admiration of your teachers and parents.
sentences.chinese: 且不說師長稱羨，升名校，獲高獎也都是小菜一碟。

sentences.english: To the outside observer, creating a 3D film must look like a piece of cake.
sentences.chinese: 在外行們眼裏，製作3D電影看起來就像小菜一碟。

definition: small token/mere trifle (used of one's gifts)
easy as a hand's turn (idiom); very easy/no effort at all
pediatrics/pediatric (department)/sth of little importance/trifle/a child's play/(slang) childish/petty/stingy
stretch a hand and grab it (idiom); very easy
to be nothing difficult/to be a cinch
not to pose a problem for sb/cannot stump sb
easy/with no difficulty
enough and to spare (idiom)
lit. one hair from nine oxen (idiom)/fig. a drop in the ocean
simple home-style meal/common occurrence/nothing out of the ordinary
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
lunatic ravings/nonsense/pipe dream
lit. to drive a lightweight chariot on a familiar road (idiom)/fig. to do sth routinely and with ease/a walk in the park
lit. to stretch a hand and grab it (idiom)/fig. easy to do
see 小試牛刀|小试牛刀[xiao3 shi4 niu2 dao1]
lit. even harder than reaching the sky (idiom)/fig. extremely difficult/far from an easy task
